Package com.bewsoftware.utils.crypto

Class PBKDF2

java.lang.Object
com.bewsoftware.utils.crypto.PBKDF2
public class PBKDF2 extends Object
Secure Password Storage v2.0.

PBKDF2 salted password hashing with HMAC and SHA512.

Source: https://github.com/defuse/password-hashing/blob/master/PasswordStorage.java

Downloaded: 07/10/2021.

Renamed and modified by Bradley Willcott

Since:
v1.0.10
Version:
v1.0.10
Author:
Taylor Hornby @ defuse.ca, Bradley Willcott

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException
    This exception is thrown when something is wrong with the platform your code is running on, and for some reason it's not safe to verify a password on it.
    static class 
    PBKDF2.InvalidHashException
    The correctHash parameter you gave to the verifyPassword method was somehow corrupted.

  • Method Details

    • createHash

      public static String createHash(String password) throws PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException
      Returns a salted PBKDF2 hash of the password.
      Parameters:
      password - the password to hash
      Returns:
      a salted PBKDF2 hash of the password
      Throws:
      PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException

    • generateKey

      public static SecretKey generateKey(int n) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Generate an AES key with size of n (128, 192, and 256) bits.

      Source: https://www.baeldung.com/java-aes-encryption-decryption

      Modified by Bradley Willcott (06/10/2021)

      Parameters:
      n - size of key to generate (in bits)
      Returns:
      generated secret key
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • getKeyFromPassword

      public static SecretKey getKeyFromPassword(String password, String salt) throws PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException
      Generate an AES key from a given password.

      Source: https://www.baeldung.com/java-aes-encryption-decryption

      Modified by Bradley Willcott (06/10/2021)

      Parameters:
      password - to use
      salt - to use
      Returns:
      generated secret key
      Throws:
      PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Tests the basic functionality of the PBKDF2 class
      Parameters:
      args - ignored

    • verifyPassword

      public static boolean verifyPassword(String password, String correctHash) throws PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException, PBKDF2.InvalidHashException
      Validates a password using a hash.
      Parameters:
      password - the password to check
      correctHash - the hash of the valid password
      Returns:
      true if the password is correct, false if not
      Throws:
      PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException
      PBKDF2.InvalidHashException

    • fromBase64

      private static byte[] fromBase64(String hex) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Convert a string of Base64 characters into byte array.
      Parameters:
      hex - the Base64 text to convert
      Returns:
      the decoded text
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • pbkdf2

      private static byte[] pbkdf2(char[] password, byte[] salt, int iterations, int bytes) throws PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException
      Computes the PBKDF2 hash of a password.
      Parameters:
      password - the password to hash.
      salt - the salt
      iterations - the iteration count (slowness factor)
      bytes - the length of the hash to compute in bytes
      Returns:
      the PBDKF2 hash of the password
      Throws:
      PBKDF2.CannotPerformOperationException

    • slowEquals

      private static boolean slowEquals(byte[] a, byte[] b)
      Compares two byte arrays in length-constant time. This comparison method is used so that password hashes cannot be extracted from an on-line system using a timing attack and then attacked off-line.
      Parameters:
      a - the first byte array
      b - the second byte array
      Returns:
      true if both byte arrays are the same, false if not

    • toBase64

      private static String toBase64(byte[] array)
      Converts a byte array into a string of Base64 characters.
      Parameters:
      array - the byte array to convert
      Returns:
      the string of Base64 characters
